parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A field-laborer; then: a laborer, workman in general. From ergon; a toiler; figuratively, a teacher.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To change my place (abode), leave, depart, remove, pass over. From meta and the base of basis; to change place.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
